text: “In the Absence” shows what happened inside the South Korean passenger ferry that sank while travelling between Incheon and Jeju Island, killing 304 people. https://t.co/DbsSnhFQ2F

text: “People will really come out for the next election and campaign and rally harder,” a Trump voter who believes the President’s claims that the election was a hoax said. “It’s only going to awaken more of a sleeping tiger.” https://t.co/8bV0DauO4M

name: NewYorker
text:

name: NewYorker
text: In the 1980s, Princess Diana’s black-sheep sweater, which was recently reissued, became about as viral as an item of clothing could be in the era before social media. https://t.co/tHKK6bTuFx

name: NewYorker
text: Pick up your phone and scroll through news apps for one hour. Then slowly put your phone down and leave it there for one minute. Repeat this over and over. https://t.co/oywRcfrdGR

name: NewYorker
text: In the recordings collected on “Joni Mitchell Archives—Vol. 1: The Early Years (1963-1967),” listeners can sense Mitchell feeling into the corners of her talent, poking and stretching it. https://t.co/23OG9yYLhN

name: NewYorker
text: Fiona Apple describes the feeling of finding the right lyrics for a song as having the words “glide down the back of my throat." She writes the alphabet above her drafts, searching, with puzzle-solver focus, for puns, rhymes, and accidental insights. https://t.co/xZmfXKkolA

name: NewYorker
text: In his own life, William Faulkner failed to truly acknowledge the evils of slavery and segregation. But he did so with savage thoroughness in his fiction. https://t.co/3REKTJiSu2

name: NewYorker
text: Mark Ellison has spent his life building other people’s dream homes, sometimes working on projects worth $50 million or more, but has never felt the desire to own any of those houses. In fact, he’d much rather live in a firehouse. https://t.co/RtEzKnuJRT

name: NewYorker
text: “These days, I’m looking at most babies and feeling nothing at all.” https://t.co/RD28WnKoYA
